- I had an account and played for a long time,
and then when I was like 13, I just decided,
I was like, "You know what, I'm done playing this game.
"I've put enough time into this."
And then I gave my account to some neighborhood kid.
And then like a year later, I was like,
"You know what, I kinda wanna start playing RuneScape again."
And then just logged in and changed the password
so he couldn't get back on it.
Just stole the account back.
Yeah, and then just like for quite a while
would message his friends and be like,
"Hey man, I'm gonna kill myself."
(laughing)
And they thought it was still him.
- Caleb, you were truly a monster.
- I know, I know.
- Caleb child story is like some insane shit.
- I love your story about you and your brothers
where it's just like, yeah, if we had a younger brother,
we'd just kick the shit out of him
and like make him wanna die.
- Yeah.
- That's pretty much how it went, yeah.
- That's my older brother.
- Here, you bullied your older brother?
- Yeah, me and Eric bullied Paul.
- Damn.
- We like, so Paul and I had to share a room,
and then one day we just got into a small fight,
and then he left, I think he had football practice,
and Eric and I just moved all of his stuff upstairs,
and just didn't tell him.
like had to come home.
He kept all, he stole a shopping cart from Walmart
and then kept all of his clothes in a shopping cart.
So Eric and I had to carry the shopping cart
from the basement to the upstairs like part of the house.
- Just like imagine someone's sharing blood with Patrick
who played football in high school.
- Right, yeah.
- It's wonderful.
- They both did. - Patrick is a,
- They both played football. - Patrick's a skater.
- That's an athletic, he's an athlete.
- Honestly, Patrick, you should leave
before the trains close.
- Oh yeah, what time is it?
- Oh no.
- Yeah, I might be late.
- Yeah, goddamn, what are we at?
- We're at an hour, that's fine.
- Oh, cool.
- Okay, we're at hell, yeah.
Honestly, Caleb, I miss you so much.
- Yeah, I miss you too, buddy.
- And every day without you here is a nightmare.
- I'll be back in a month.
- I'm so happy to see you.
You look thin, you look handsome.
- Thank you, you as well.
- Yeah, you should look into hair plugs before you come back.
(laughing)
- Thanks, thanks.
Thanks.
Yeah, I will.
You look healthy though.
You should look into SSRIs maybe.
(laughing)
Honestly, salute dude.
Couldn't be me.
All right.
Follow Tom on Twitter at--
Doer, D-O-E-R-I-F-I-T.
That is not how you spell it.
You already fucked it up.
Doer of it.
Doer of it.
Yeah.
Yeah.
It looks like Doryo fit.
Which would be a cooler way to read it.
Yeah.
Caleb, I love you.
Love you too, buddy.
Yeah.

title: Premium #4: tom and caleb catching up
